Conference Spotlight

### Resisting AI with Dr. Dan McQuillan

In this talk, Dr. Dan McQuillan, author of Resisting AI, explores the social and political dimensions of artificial intelligence beyond its technical scope. By examining AI’s deep learning and generative AI operations, Dr. McQuillan reveals how AI systems can amplify social harms and become entangled with institutional power structures.

We’ve just wrapped up our last, and best, conference of the year, ODSC West 2024. Weren’t able to join us in... ![Image 21: Watch Now: The Top West 2024 Recordings for Free](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/ODSC-Rothman.jpg)

We’ve just wrapped up our last, and best, conference of the year, [**ODSC West 2024**](https://odsc.com/california/?__hstc=39712252.1099ebafe39599d542bc64d6f48f0d60.1731460772958.1731460772958.1731460772958.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460772958&__hsfp=2038185260). Weren’t able to join us in San Francisco or on our virtual platform? [Here are recordings](https://app.aiplus.training/collections) of a few of our most popular talks, workshops, and training sessions.

### **Introduction to Containers for Data Science/Data Engineering**

Michael A Fudge | Professor of Practice, MSIS Program Director | Syracuse University’s iSchool

In this hands-on session, you’ll learn how to leverage the benefits of containers for DS and data engineering workflows. You’ll start with the basics of how containers work and their advantages for data science and data engineering and finish with more advanced topics like building, configuring, or customizing images to include your specific project dependencies and containerizing dependent services like databases and integrating them with your project

### **A Gentle Introduction to Vector Databases and Their Implementation**

Balaji Dhamodharan | Data Science Leader | NXP Semiconductors

In the rapidly advancing field of artificial intelligence, having a strong understanding of foundational technologies is key to leveraging their full potential. This session provides a gentle introduction to vector databases. You’ll start by demystifying what vector databases are, with clear definitions, simple explanations, and real-world examples of popular vector databases. You will also gain a practical understanding of how vector databases work, including the processes involved in storing, retrieving, and managing data in high-dimensional vector spaces. The session will culminate in a comprehensive hands-on workshop, where participants will implement a vector database from scratch, gaining valuable experience in real-world applications.

### **Building Reliable Voice Agents with Open Source Tools**

Sara Zanzottera | Lead AI Engineer | Kwal

Although Large Language Models (LLMs) are great at writing, are they able to \_talk\_ like a human? Voice Agents are LLM-powered applications that can listen to users and talk back to them with a realistic voice, handle interruptions, and improvise while sticking to the goal they’re given.

In this session, you will learn how they’re made and which open-source tools are available to build them. You’ll also see in practice how to build one, while examining their current industry impact and what the challenges of bringing a voice agent PoC to production are.

### **Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback**

Luis Serrano, PhD | Author of Grokking Machine Learning and Creator of Serrano Academy

In this session, you’ll explore the widely used LLM fine-tuning method of Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF). In particular, you will cover how RLHF is used to fine-tune LLMs, Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO), and Direct Preference Optimization (DPO).

### **Dimensional Data Modeling in the Modern Era**

Dustin Dorsey |Principal Data Architect |Onix

With the emergence of big data, cloud computing, and AI-driven analytics, many wonder if the traditional principles of dimensional modeling still hold value. In this session, you’ll take a deep dive into the evolution of dimensional modeling, exploring how it has adapted to modern technologies like data lakes, real-time analytics, and scalable cloud platforms. We’ll also discuss why, despite these technological advancements, dimensional modeling continues to be a vital framework for building data systems that are not only scalable and high-performing but also intuitive and easy to manage. This session will provide valuable insights for anyone looking to understand the enduring importance of dimensional modeling in the modern era.

### **Topological Deep Learning Made Easy with TopoX**

Dr. Mustafa Hajij | Assistant Professor | University of San Francisco

Learn about \*\*TopoX\*\*, a Python software suite designed for topological deep learning, enabling computation and learning on complex topological structures beyond graphs. In this tutorial, you’ll cover three core components of TopoX: \*\*TopoNetX\*\*, \*\*TopoEmbedX\*\*, and \*\*TopoModelX\*\*. Through hands-on examples and practical demonstrations, you’ll learn how to leverage these tools for deep learning tasks on complex topological structures and leave you well-equipped to apply \*\*TopoX\*\* in your own research or projects related to topological deep learning.

Gary Marcus at ODSC West 2024: "Examining LLM's Strengths, Weaknesses, and Future Pathways"

Gary Marcus, Scientist, Author, and Professor Emeritus at NYU

### **Building LLM Applications Using Open-source Models**

Sudip Shrestha, PhD | Data Science Lead/ Sr. Manager | Asi Government

Learn how to build applications using open-source large language models (LLMs), whatever your skill level. In this session, you’ll learn about the basics of LLMs and how they work, with a focus on popular open-source models. You will be introduced to the Hugging Face ecosystem and will cover a code walkthrough on building an LLM application using an open-source model. By the end of the talk, you will have a clear understanding of how to get started with LLMs using open-source tools, regardless of their prior experience in AI.

### **Building an Agentic Rag Application with LangGraph**

Valentina Alto | AI and Apps Technical Architect | Microsoft

This hands-on workshop will immerse you in the world of Agent-based Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), a cutting-edge approach that integrates agents with retrieval systems to build smarter, more adaptive GenAI solutions. By the end of the session, you’ll gain practical insights into creating multi-agent systems that utilize specialized RAG pipelines for different tasks, leveraging AI agents to make intelligent decisions.

### **Building Agentic and Multi-Agent Systems with LangGraph**

Greg Loughnane | Co-Founder & CEO | AI Makerspace

Chris Alexiuk | Head of LLMs at AI Makerspace | Founding Machine Learning Engineer at Ox

In this session, you’ll explore all the concepts and code you need to understand and build the industry-standard agentic and multi-agent systems, from soup to nuts, with LangChain. By the end of this session, you’ll have learned how to build RAG applications with LangChain, build agentic RAG applications with LangGraph, and develop multi-agent workflows with LangGraph.

The realm of autonomous agents is rapidly expanding. This comes with groundbreaking innovations that could reshape industries and alter how we... ![Image 21: ODSC West 2024 Keynote: Untapped Capital’s Yohei Nakajima: The Current and Future State of Autonomous Agents](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/shutterstock_2458211089-640x300.jpg)

The realm of autonomous agents is rapidly expanding. This comes with groundbreaking innovations that could reshape industries and alter how we interact with machines. At the recent ODSC West 2024, Yohei Nakajima, a venture capitalist and the creative force behind BabyAGI, took the stage to present his insights on autonomous agents’ present landscape and potential future.

Nakajima’s experience as a partner at Untapped Capital and his hands-on approach to emerging technologies offered attendees an exclusive look at the latest advancements and challenges facing autonomous agents.

### The Current and Future State of Autonomous Agents.

Autonomous agents are already influencing a broad array of sectors. From customer service to high-stakes AI research, these agents are already driving innovation. During the keynote, Nakajima highlighted how these agents are doing more than automating routine tasks. These bots are also tackling more complex roles requiring decision-making and adaptability.

In customer service, for instance, agents can answer inquiries, resolve complaints, and even anticipate customer needs by analyzing historical data patterns. Similarly, in healthcare, autonomous systems are streamlining diagnostic processes, while in finance, they help manage risk assessment and compliance monitoring.

![Image 22: ODSC West 2024 Keynote: Yohei Nakajima virtual keynote recap](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Screenshot-2024-11-05-124103-1024x544.png)

One of the standout features of these agents is their ability to act independently within predefined boundaries, meaning that once they’re programmed and given a set of objectives, they can operate with minimal human input. However, this autonomy brings about technical and ethical challenges. For example, Nakajima explained the complexities involved in agent decision-making, especially when balancing operational efficiency with ethical boundaries, such as privacy and bias concerns.

### Challenges and the Path Forward

Despite their capabilities, autonomous agents face substantial technical hurdles. As Nakajima discussed, issues like task management, real-time data processing, and adaptation to unpredictable scenarios are ongoing obstacles. In building BabyAGI, Nakajima encountered these challenges firsthand, as creating an agent with task-planning capabilities required extensive programming to ensure accuracy, relevance, and adaptability. Agents like BabyAGI have made significant strides but must continue evolving to manage increasingly complex tasks without direct supervision.

![Image 23: ODSC West 2024 Keynote: Yohei Nakajima virtual keynote recap 2](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Screenshot-2024-11-05-132757-1024x534.png)

Nakajima also addressed a critical technical question for the future of [autonomous agents](https://opendatascience.com/mastering-generative-ai-ai-agents-and-agi/): how can agents be designed to improve themselves over time? By utilizing frameworks that enable learning from past actions, agents could become more efficient and reliable. This concept of “self-improvement” is key to the next phase of autonomous agents, where machines could theoretically collaborate on multi-step projects, learning from feedback to refine their decision-making.

### Ethical Considerations: Autonomy vs. Control

As autonomous agents take on more responsibilities, ethical considerations about the degree of autonomy given to machines are becoming more pronounced. Nakajima highlighted potential scenarios where machines could handle entire systems with little human oversight, a prospect that raises questions about accountability, fairness, and safety.

One key consideration is setting limits on [agent autonomy](https://opendatascience.com/ai-for-robotics-and-autonomy-with-francis-x-govers-iii/) to prevent unintended consequences. He noted that a balance must be struck between agent independence and human oversight to avoid risks associated with unchecked decision-making by machines.

![Image 26: ODSC West 2024 Keynote: Yohei Nakajima virtual keynote recap 3](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Screenshot-2024-11-05-135341-1024x468.png)

### The Future: Collaborative and Self-Evolving Agents

Looking ahead, Nakajima shared his vision for a future where autonomous agents might work collaboratively, coordinating across platforms and industries without constant human intervention. Such agents could autonomously divide tasks, manage priorities, and work together on complex projects, from orchestrating logistics for global supply chains to supporting disaster relief efforts. Nakajima believes that innovations in AI frameworks and task-management systems will soon make this a reality, though it will require careful integration with existing technology stacks and continued attention to ethical and technical safeguards.

[Boost Your Career with Hands-On AI Training at ODSC West 2024](https://opendatascience.com/boost-your-career-with-hands-on-ai-training-at-odsc-west-2024/)
===========================================================================================================================================================

[Conferences](https://opendatascience.com/category/conferences/ "Conferences")[Featured Post](https://opendatascience.com/category/featured-post/ "Featured Post")[West 2024](https://opendatascience.com/tag/west-2024/ "Featured Post")posted by [ODSC Team](https://opendatascience.com/user/admin_odsc/ "Featured Post") October 22, 2024 ODSC Team

[West 2024~46~](https://opendatascience.com/tag/west-2024/ "West 2024")

AI and data science landscape will continue to evolve rapidly. So professionals must gain more than theoretical knowledge— not only that,... ![Image 21: Boost Your Career with Hands-On AI Training at ODSC West 2024](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Bris-326-640x300.jpg)

AI and data science landscape will continue to evolve rapidly. So professionals must gain more than theoretical knowledge— not only that, they need hands-on experience with the latest tools and techniques to stay competitive. This is where [ODSC West 2024](https://odsc.com/california/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260) comes in.

At [ODSC West 2024](https://opendatascience.com/tag/west-2024/), attendees will have the perfect opportunity to do just that with its comprehensive range of hands-on training sessions, designed to enhance your skills and bring your AI applications to the next level. From foundational courses to advanced methods, these sessions cater to all experience levels, ensuring that both beginners and seasoned data scientists can deepen their expertise.

Here’s a breakdown of some of the must-attend training sessions at ODSC West 2024, divided by skill level.

### Beginner Sessions

For those just starting their journey into AI and machine learning, ODSC West offers a range of beginner-friendly training sessions designed to introduce key concepts and tools in a hands-on, practical manner.

*   [**Intro to Building Enterprise-Ready Gen AI Applications with Vector Databases**](https://odsc.com/speakers/intro-to-building-enterprise-ready-gen-ai-applications-with-vector-databases/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): This session is perfect for those interested in learning how to implement generative AI applications using vector databases. You will gain the foundational knowledge required to build scalable AI systems that can be deployed in an enterprise setting. This training will guide you through every step, from concept to execution.
*   [**Going from Unstructured Data to Vector Similarity Search:**](https://odsc.com/speakers/going-from-unstructured-data-to-vector-similarity-search-2/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260) In this session, participants will learn how to handle unstructured data and transform it into meaningful insights using vector similarity search. This hands-on course will introduce tools and techniques that are critical for those working with large datasets or developing search-related AI applications.

### Intermediate Sessions

For those with some experience under their belt, ODSC West offers a variety of intermediate-level sessions that dive deeper into the intricacies of AI applications, development, and deployment.

*   [**LLMs from Prototype to Production: LLMOps, Prompt Engineering, and Moving LLMs to the Cloud**](https://odsc.com/speakers/llms-from-prototype-to-production-llmops-prompt-engineering-and-moving-llms-to-the-cloud/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): This session is a must for professionals working with large language models (LLMs). Learn how to take your LLM prototypes to production by mastering LLMOps, prompt engineering, and cloud deployment strategies. It’s an essential course for those looking to integrate LLMs into their workflows.
*   [**Uncertainty Quantification**](https://odsc.com/speakers/uncertainty-quantification-approaches-and-methods-2/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): Approaches and Methods: Understanding uncertainty in AI models is critical for improving decision-making and model reliability. This training session will cover advanced methods to quantify uncertainty in AI models, giving you the tools to better assess the risks and confidence levels of your AI applications.
*   [**Building a Multimodal AI Assistant: Build an AI Application Using Advanced RAG for Cross-Modal Data Retrieval**](https://odsc.com/speakers/building-a-multimodal-ai-assistant-build-an-ai-application-using-advanced-rag-for-cross-modal-data-retrieval/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260)**:** Multimodal AI applications are at the forefront of innovation. In this session, you’ll learn how to build a cutting-edge AI assistant using advanced retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques for handling cross-modal data retrieval. It’s ideal for professionals looking to expand their AI capabilities.
*   [**Building with Llama 3**](https://odsc.com/speakers/building-with-llama-3-2/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): This session offers an in-depth look at building with the Llama 3 model, providing hands-on experience in deploying Llama for various use cases. Whether you’re working with LLMs or developing new AI applications, this course will offer key insights.

### All Levels

For professionals at any stage of their AI journey, ODSC West also offers a range of sessions that are suitable for all skill levels, providing crucial knowledge and practical tools that can be applied immediately.

*   [**Develop LLM-Powered Applications with LangChain and LangGraph**](https://odsc.com/speakers/develop-llm-powered-applications-with-langchain-and-langgraph-2/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): Whether you are a novice or an expert, learning to develop applications powered by large language models (LLMs) is an invaluable skill. This session will provide you with the practical skills to leverage LLM frameworks like LangChain and LangGraph, which are essential for developing scalable AI applications.
*   [**Introduction to Containers for Data Science & Data Engineering**](https://odsc.com/speakers/introduction-to-containers-for-data-science-data-engineering/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260)**:** Containers are critical for reproducibility and scalability in data science projects. This training session will teach you how to use containerization technologies like Docker to streamline your workflows, making your projects more efficient and easier to manage.
*   [**Enhancing AI Accuracy with Advanced Data Augmentation Techniques**](https://odsc.com/speakers/enhancing-ai-accuracy-with-advanced-data-augmentation-techniques/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): Data augmentation is a powerful technique to improve the accuracy of your AI models. This all-levels session will explore advanced methods of data augmentation, giving you the tools to enhance your model performance regardless of your experience level.
*   [**Mastering Web Data Acquisition Techniques**](https://odsc.com/speakers/mastering-web-data-acquisition-techniques/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260): Extracting data from the web is a crucial skill for many AI applications. This session will teach you how to acquire web data efficiently, offering tips and strategies that are useful whether you are new to data scraping or an experienced professional.

### Take the Next Step in Your AI Career

Pretty great right? As you can see, [ODSC West 2024](https://odsc.com/california/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260) offers an unparalleled opportunity to learn from experts and gain hands-on experience with the latest AI tools and techniques. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced data scientist, these training sessions will help you stay ahead in this rapidly evolving field. Be sure to check the [schedule](https://odsc.com/?__hstc=39712252.e19039c9fd023c2773ab47f765cae582.1731460840375.1731460840375.1731460840375.1&__hssc=39712252.1.1731460840375&__hsfp=2038185260) for the full list of training sessions and secure your spot today.

So don’t miss this opportunity to transform your knowledge into actionable expertise.

[Vatican and Microsoft Unveil AI-Driven Digital Twin of St. Peter’s Basilica for Virtual Visits and Preservation](https://opendatascience.com/vatican-and-microsoft-unveil-ai-driven-digital-twin-of-st-peters-basilica-for-virtual-visits-and-preservation/)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

[AI and Data Science News](https://opendatascience.com/category/news/ "AI and Data Science News")posted by [ODSC Team](https://opendatascience.com/user/admin_odsc/ "AI and Data Science News") November 11, 2024 ODSC Team

The Vatican and Microsoft have unveiled an AI-powered digital twin of St. Peter’s Basilica, allowing virtual access to one of the... ![Image 21: Vatican and Microsoft Unveil AI-Driven Digital Twin of St. Peter’s Basilica for Virtual Visits and Preservation](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Untitled-design-1-2.png)

The Vatican and Microsoft have [unveiled](https://apnews.com/article/vatican-microsoft-basilica-artificial-intelligence-c37d066dc7455ffacece2457c4f8e1a1) an AI-powered digital twin of St. Peter’s Basilica, allowing virtual access to one of the most iconic monuments in the world. The initiative, announced on Monday, aims to enhance visitor experience, manage crowd flow, and identify conservation needs for the centuries-old church.

### High-Tech Preservation for a Historic Monument

The project leverages cutting-edge technology to create a 3D replica of the basilica using 400,000 [high-resolution images](https://opendatascience.com/new-method-brings-together-ai-and-satellite-imagery-to-map-crop-livestock-integration-systems/) captured by drones, cameras, and lasers. These images, collected over four weeks when the basilica was empty, have been meticulously processed using advanced photogrammetry and AI techniques to produce an ultra-precise digital model.

Microsoft’s president, Brad Smith, highlighted the scale of the project during a Vatican press conference, calling it “_one of the most technologically advanced and sophisticated projects of its kind_.”

The digital model incorporates a staggering 22 petabytes of data, equivalent to five million DVDs, enabling the Vatican to assess structural integrity and detect early signs of deterioration, such as missing mosaic pieces and subtle fissures that are invisible to the naked eye.

### Enhancing Accessibility and Visitor Management

The initiative comes ahead of the Vatican’s 2025 Jubilee, a holy year expected to draw over 30 million pilgrims, significantly increasing the regular daily influx of 50,000 visitors. In preparation, the Vatican is introducing an online booking system that will allow visitors to reserve entry times, reducing long queues and optimizing the flow of tourists.

The virtual platform also enables users worldwide to explore the basilica’s architectural splendor and historical significance from the comfort of their homes. Pope Francis expressed his gratitude to [Microsoft](https://opendatascience.com/googles-ai-driven-cloud-growth-signals-opportunities-for-amazon-and-microsoft/) and the development teams, emphasizing the importance of using technology ethically.

“_Everyone, really everyone, should feel welcome in this great house,_” the pontiff remarked. He underscored the role of modern technology in preserving a piece of world heritage while spreading the church’s message of faith.

### A Fusion of Faith and Innovation

The project’s capabilities go beyond virtual tours. The AI-powered system is already proving invaluable in identifying structural concerns, allowing the Vatican to address potential damage more efficiently. “The speed and precision with which these tools detect issues far surpass human capabilities,” noted Smith.

Pope Francis has consistently advocated for the [responsible use of AI](https://opendatascience.com/strategies-for-implementing-responsible-ai-governance-and-risk-management/), calling for global regulations to ensure that technological advancements are aligned with core human values. During an audience with the project’s team, he reflected on how modern technology can help safeguard both the spiritual and material dimensions of cultural heritage.

“_This house of prayer for all peoples has been entrusted to us by those who preceded us in faith,_” he said. “_It is a gift and a task to care for it, even through the latest technologies._”

### A Continuing Commitment to Digital Preservation

Microsoft’s investment in this project is part of a broader commitment to using AI for cultural preservation. The tech giant has previously embarked on similar initiatives, including creating digital models of Mont Saint-Michel in France and Ancient Olympia in Greece.

While Smith declined to disclose the financial scope of the Vatican project, he described it as a “substantial” effort inspired by Pope Francis’ 2018 initiative to promote ethical AI practices.

[AI and Data Science News](https://opendatascience.com/category/news/ "AI and Data Science News")posted by [ODSC Team](https://opendatascience.com/user/admin_odsc/ "AI and Data Science News") November 11, 2024 ODSC Team AI companies, including industry leader OpenAI, are encountering unexpected roadblocks in their pursuit of increasingly powerful LLMs. According to Reuters, as... ![Image 6: AI Giants Shift Focus as Scaling Limits LLMS, Embracing Human-Like Reasoning Techniques](https://opendatascience.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/shutterstock_2354631481-639x300.jpg) AI companies, including industry leader OpenAI, are encountering unexpected roadblocks in their pursuit of increasingly powerful LLMs. According to [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/technology/artificial-intelligence/openai-rivals-seek-new-path-smarter-ai-current-methods-hit-limitations-2024-11-11/), as current methods reach their limits, these firms are exploring novel training techniques that mimic human-like thinking to overcome the challenges of scaling. These developments could significantly reshape the competitive landscape of AI, potentially altering the demand for resources like energy and specialized chips. In the past decade, AI advancements have been driven by the “bigger is better” philosophy, which relies on feeding models with vast amounts of data and computing power. However, according to Ilya Sutskever, co-founder of [Safe Superintelligence](https://opendatascience.com/former-openai-co-founder-announces-new-company-focused-on-safe-development-of-superintelligence/) and former co-founder of [OpenAI](https://opendatascience.com/openai-prepares-for-the-next-frontier-with-orion-ai-model-release-by-december/), this approach has hit a plateau. “The 2010s were the age of scaling, now we’re back in the age of wonder and discovery once again,” Sutskever remarked. His new venture, SSI, is focusing on innovative ways to train AI beyond just scaling existing models. ### Shifting From Scaling to Human-Like Reasoning OpenAI’s recently released “o1” model is an example of this shift in strategy. Researchers are turning to techniques like “test-time compute,” which enhances a model’s performance during the inference phase—the moment the AI is actively generating responses. Rather than merely scaling up data and computational resources, this technique allows models to “think” through problems step-by-step, much like human reasoning. This multi-step process optimizes the use of computing power, especially for complex tasks such as mathematical problem-solving and coding challenges. Noam Brown, a researcher at OpenAI, highlighted the effectiveness of this approach during a [TED AI conference](https://venturebeat.com/ai/openai-noam-brown-stuns-ted-ai-conference-20-seconds-of-thinking-worth-100000x-more-data/), saying, “_It turned out that having a bot think for just 20 seconds in a hand of poker achieved the same performance boost as scaling up the model by 100,000 times._” ### The AI Race Heats Up: Competitors Enter the Fray OpenAI’s rivals, including [Google DeepMind](https://opendatascience.com/google-deepmind-introduces-musicrl-model/), [Anthropic](https://opendatascience.com/anthropic-teams-up-with-palantir-and-aws-to-bring-ai-to-u-s-defense/), and [xAI](https://opendatascience.com/elon-musk-hyping-up-xais-grok-3-with-massive-gpu-investment/), are also exploring similar methods to enhance their models’ capabilities. These new techniques could disrupt the AI hardware market, which has been dominated by NVIDIA’s AI training chips. As AI companies shift focus from pre-training to inference, the demand for distributed inference clouds could increase. This shift may open the door for competitors to challenge NVIDIA’s dominance in the AI chip sector. Sonya Huang, a partner at Sequoia Capital, noted, “_This shift will move us from a world of massive pre-training clusters toward inference clouds, which are distributed, cloud-based servers for inference._” Venture capital firms like Sequoia and Andreessen Horowitz, which have invested billions in AI development, are closely watching this transition as it could impact their significant bets on AI companies. ### Implications for the Future of AI Hardware [NVIDIA](https://opendatascience.com/breaking-openai-partners-with-broadcom-and-tsmc-to-build-custom-ai-chip-scales-back-foundry-plans/), which recently surpassed Apple as the world’s most valuable company, has acknowledged the shift in AI training dynamics. CEO Jensen Huang addressed this change at a recent conference, stating, “_We’ve now discovered a second scaling law, and this is the scaling law at a time of inference…All of these factors have led to the demand for Blackwell being incredibly high_.” NVIDIA’s focus on inference optimization suggests that while demand for training chips may slow, the market for inference chips is set to expand.
